intro: Brachyloma elongatum, commonly known as the slender brachyloma, is a flowering plant native to south-eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Its growth habit is typically prostrate or spreading, forming dense mats on the ground. Brachyloma elongatum is often found in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats.
